bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Modifications required in respect of northern
        municipality

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of applying this Act to the northern municipality,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a reference in this Act to a regional board or the board of a regional district
            is to be read as a reference to the council of the northern municipality, and

a reference in this Act to a director of a regional board is to be read as a
            reference to a council member of the council of the northern municipality.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purpose of applying sections 15 (3) (b) and 26 (1) to the northern
          municipality, the references in those sections to the chair and financial officer of the
          regional district are to be read as references to the mayor and financial officer of the
          northern municipality.

The Municipal Finance Authority of British Columbia is continued as a corporation
          without share capital.

The members of the corporation are the persons appointed by the regional boards of
          each regional district in accordance with this section.

The number of votes to which a regional district is entitled is that number
          obtained by dividing the population of the regional district by 50 000, except that if the
          resulting quotient is not an integer the number of votes is the next highest
          integer.

The number of members to which a regional district is entitled is that number
          obtained by dividing the number of votes to which a regional district is entitled under
            subsection (3) by 5, except that if the resulting quotient is not an integer the number
          of members is the next highest integer.
No member has more than 5 votes.

The votes to which a regional district is entitled are to be distributed as evenly
          as possible among its members.

The regional board must notify the secretary of the authority of the number of
          votes assigned to each member.

When voting, a member may cast the votes assigned to the member only in a
          bloc.

Not later than the last day of February in each year, the regional board of each
          regional district must appoint from among its directors the required number of persons as
          members of the authority for that year or until a successor is appointed.

The regional board of each regional district may appoint from among its directors,
          persons to act as alternate members, who are to take the place of, and have the vote of, a
          specified member of the authority in the case of a necessary absence from a meeting of the
          authority.

An alternate member may not vote on a matter, unless notice of the members
          appointment is filed with the secretary of the authority.

Despite any other provision in this section, a person who is a member or alternate
          member of the authority on the date this subsection comes into force and who was appointed
          by the regional board of the Northern Rockies Regional District continues as a member or
          alternate member of the authority until a successor is appointed by the council of the
          northern municipality.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The objects of the authority are the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
providing interim financing and lease financing for institutions for the purposes
          referred to in sections 11 and 11.1;

providing short term investment opportunities for institutions by the
          establishment and operation of pooled investment funds under section 16.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
At its first meeting, to be held not later than March 31 in each year, the members
          of the authority must elect one of their number as chair to hold office until a successor
          is elected and for this purpose each member has one vote.

Subject to subsection (1), the members of the authority must meet at the times and
          places determined by the chair, but any 6 members of the authority may, at any time, by
          notice in writing directed to the chair, require a meeting to be called.

A majority of the members, having among them a majority of the votes, constitute a
          quorum for the transaction of business.

Except as otherwise provided, all bylaws and resolutions of the authority must be
          decided by a majority of the votes of the members who are at the meeting and entitled to
          vote on them.

A vacancy in the membership does not impair the power of the remaining members to
          act.

A resolution that is approved in writing, or by telex, telegraph, telephone or
          other similar means of communication confirmed in writing or other graphic communication,
          by a majority of the members is as valid as if it were passed at a meeting of the members
          properly called and constituted.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The head office of the authority must be in the Capital Regional
        District.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The authority must appoint a treasurer and a secretary, who may be the same
          person.

bcl:text.#text:
Sections 236 and 237 of the  apply to the
          secretary and treasurer respectively.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The executive and administrative powers and duties of the authority are to be
          exercised and performed by a Board of Trustees, consisting of the chair of the authority
          and 9 other members of the authority, so that the trustees are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 4 members of the authority representing the Metro Vancouver Regional District,

one member of the authority representing the Capital Regional District,
            and

5 members of the authority from among the members representing the remaining
            regional districts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
At its first meeting in each year, the authority must elect the required number of
          trustees to hold office for that year or until their successors are elected.
Six trustees constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.
The chair of the authority is the chair of the trustees.

Subject to the provisions of a procedure bylaw adopted by the authority, the
          trustees must meet at the times and places determined by the chair.
Each trustee has one vote on all questions.

All questions must be decided by a majority vote of the trustees present at a
          meeting and entitled to vote on the question.

A resolution that is approved in writing or by telex, telegraph, telephone or
          other similar means of communication confirmed in writing or other graphic communication,
          by a majority of the trustees is as valid as if it were passed at a meeting of the
          trustees properly called and constituted.

The trustees may engage employees, other than the secretary and the treasurer,
          required to carry out the purposes of the authority.

The trustees must prepare an annual operating budget for the approval of the
          authority.

Without limiting subsection (1), the powers of the authority under sections
            10 to
            16
          must be exercised by the trustees.

Securities and interest coupons held or issued by the authority under this Act may
          be held in trust for the authority.

Without limiting subsection (1), securities and interest coupons may be
          held by a depository agency in a book-based system for the central handling of securities
          and interest coupons that provides for the transfer of the securities by bookkeeping entry
          without physical delivery of the securities or interest coupons.

For any purpose under this Act, the authority may lend securities and interest
          coupons held by it if the loan is fully secured by cash or securities satisfactory to the
          trustees.

The authority may enter into any of the following agreements for the purpose of
          reducing risks or maximizing benefits in relation to the borrowing, lending or investment
          of money under this Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: currency exchange agreements;
spot and future currency agreements;
interest rate exchange agreements;
future interest rate agreements.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The authority must review the outstanding requests for financing, and in
        consideration of the relevant market and economic conditions, may authorize the issue and
        sale of securities to raise a specified amount in the manner determined by the
        trustees.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, the trustees may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
borrow amounts of money authorized by the authority under section 9,
            and

issue securities of the authority bearing interest at the rate and payable as to
            principal and interest at the time, and the place, and in the currency of the countries
            the trustees may determine.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The securities may be made redeemable in advance of maturity at the time, and at
          the price the trustees may determine in the resolution authorizing their issue.

For the purposes of this Act, and without limiting the generality of it, the
          trustees may provide for the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
payment, refunding or renewal of all or any part of any securities issued by the
            authority;
payment of any other liability or indebtedness of the authority;

the inscription, registration, transfer, management and redemption of
            securities;

the examination, cancellation or destruction of securities and interest coupons
            that have been redeemed;

the custody and protection of securities and of materials used in their
            production.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The trustees may issue securities of the authority, in the principal amounts that,
          after payment of any discount and the costs of issue and sale, will realize the net
          amounts authorized by the authority under section 9.

The recital or declaration in the resolution of the trustees authorizing the issue
          of securities to the effect that it is necessary to issue securities in the principal
          amount so authorized to realize the net amount, is conclusive evidence of that
          fact.

The trustees may sell securities either at their par value or at less or more than
          their par value, and the purchaser is not bound to see to the application of the proceeds
          of a sale.

The securities and the interest coupons, if any, attached to them are to be in the
          form and are to be exchangeable for other securities of the same issue on any terms and
          conditions the trustees may determine.

The securities and interest coupons of the authority must be signed by the chair
          or by a person or persons designated by the trustees and countersigned by the treasurer or
          by a person or persons designated by the trustees.

The securities of the authority must be sealed with the seal of the
          authority.

The engraved, lithographed or printed signature of a person required to execute a
          security or interest coupon under subsection (8) is for all purposes the signature of that
          person and is binding on the authority even if the person whose signature is reproduced
          may not have held office at the date of the securities or interest coupons or at their
          date of delivery.

The seal of the authority may be stamped, engraved, lithographed or printed or may
          be in other facsimile form and if so reproduced has the same effect as if manually
          sealed.

At the request of a municipality, the trustees may allot a specified amount of any
          issue of securities of the authority to that municipality on its written undertaking to
          sell that amount by public subscription only.

The securities allotted under subsection (12) may be subtitled with the name of that
          municipality.

The municipality must account to the authority for money realized by the
          sale.

The trustees may delegate their powers under this section to a committee of one or
          more trustees and officers, subject to the limitations the trustees may impose.

The authority may enter into agreements with a public institution under which the
          authority provides financing for one or more of the following purposes, as applicable to
          the public institution:

bcl:text.#text: borrowing under section 177  of the  or section 404  of the ;
financing under section 178  of the  or section 405  of the ;

in:desc: [municipal temporary borrowing under loan authorization bylaw]

[regional district temporary borrowing under loan authorization
              bylaw]
bcl:text.#text:
financing under section 181  of the
             or section 409  of the ;
borrowing in anticipation of the receipt of current revenues under the ;
borrowing to meet current operating expenses under section 139 (1) of the ;

borrowing in anticipation of the receipt of current revenues under section 31 (1) of
            the ;

borrowing in anticipation of the receipt of current revenues under section 33 (1) of
            the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of subsection (1), the trustees may borrow money and may
          issue securities of the authority.

Section
            10 applies, but section 9, 14, 15 and 26 do not
          apply, to financing agreements made and securities issued under this section.

Securities issued for the purposes of this section must be payable on or before
          5 years from their date of issue.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Financing in relation to local government agreements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority may enter into agreements to provide financing

in:desc: [borrowing and liability: application of Community Charter]
bcl:text.#text:
to a local government who is a party to an agreement under section 175  of the  or section 403 
            of the , or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
to an institution prescribed under subsection (5) if that agreement
            is within a class prescribed for that institution under that subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of subsection (1), the trustees may borrow sums of money
          and issue securities of the authority.

Section
            10 applies, but sections 9, 14, 15 and 26 do not apply, to financing
          agreements made and securities issued under this section.

Securities issued for the purposes of this section must be payable on or before
          10 years from the date of their issuance.

For the purposes of allowing financing to be provided under subsection (1)
            (b), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by regulation,
          prescribe

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: eligible institutions, and

classes of eligible agreements in relation to a prescribed
            institution.

bcl:text.#text: Sections 760 to 763 of the  apply to securities issued by the authority.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The trustees may provide for registration or recognition of the authority in a
        foreign country or place, and may designate persons there, according to the laws of the
        foreign country or place, to represent the authority and to accept service for and on behalf
        of the authority of a proceeding.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, the authority has the power

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
to provide for the creation, management and application of sinking funds or
            other means of securing the repayment of securities issued by the authority, including
            the redemption by call of securities issued subject to redemption in advance of
            maturity, and

subject to approval by the inspector of municipalities, if the amount of money
            in a sinking fund for which securities are outstanding together with anticipated
            interest earnings for that fund is greater than the amount anticipated to be required to
            repay the debt or discharge the obligation, to declare that there is an anticipated
            surplus in the fund of a specified amount.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A separate account must be maintained for each sinking fund security issue of the
          authority.

Money at the credit of the sinking fund that cannot be immediately applied toward
          paying the debt or discharging the obligation because no part of the debt or obligation is
          yet payable may be invested or reinvested by the trustees in any of the
          following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: securities of the government of Canada or a province of Canada;

securities, the principal and interest of which is guaranteed by the government
            of Canada or a province of Canada;

securities of a municipality or regional district in British Columbia, or of a
            local, municipal or regional government in another province of Canada, maturing not
            later than the securities, the repayment for which the sinking fund was
            created;
investments guaranteed by a chartered bank;

deposits in a savings institution, or non-equity or membership shares of a
            credit union.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of subsection (3), all the securities, deposits, shares or
          evidences of indebtedness must be held to the credit of the sinking fund account, together
          with any interest, premium or exchange derived from them.

If more than one sinking fund account is involved, the securities and the
          interest, premium or exchange derived from them must be allocated in proportion to the
          money of the accounts used for the purchase.

Instead of investing money to the credit of the sinking fund in accordance with
            subsection
            (3) and (4), the trustees may apply any of the money standing
          to the credit of the sinking fund to the purchase of securities of the authority maturing
          not later than the securities for which the sinking fund account was created.

Securities purchased under subsection (6), together with interest, premium or
          exchange derived from them, must be held to the credit of that sinking fund
          account.
The trustees may resell securities purchased under subsection (6).

If the trustees consider it advantageous to the authority, they may, in advance of
          payments that become due under agreements with regional districts, borrow temporarily to
          purchase securities of the authority.

The trustees may delegate their powers under subsections (6) and (9) to a
          committee of one or more of the trustees and officers, subject to the limitations the
          trustees may impose.

If, after all the securities of a sinking fund issue have been repaid, there
          remains a surplus in the sinking fund account,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the surplus must be paid over to the regional districts for which financing was
            undertaken by that issue, in proportion to the amount of participation of each regional
            district in the issue, and

the regional district must distribute the payment it receives among the regional
            district and member municipalities that shared in the issue.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If there is, at any time, standing to the credit of the sinking fund account of a
          debt of the authority a surplus over the amount required to be in that account in
          accordance with the provisions of the bylaw or resolution under which the debt is created,
          the trustees may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
with the approval of the inspector of municipalities, provide for the
            application of the surplus or part of it to the payment of the amount required for the
            sinking fund in the succeeding year, and

waive the equivalent amount of the principal repayment due to the authority for
            that year under the agreements with the regional districts relating to the
            debt.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the authority declares that there is an anticipated surplus in a sinking fund
          under subsection
            (1) (b), the trustees may, with the approval of the inspector of
          municipalities, make any provision for the application of the anticipated surplus
          including, without limitation, that the surplus or a portion of the surplus must be paid
          or credited to the regional districts for which financing was undertaken by that sinking
          fund issue in proportions that take into account the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the participation of each regional district in the issue;

the term for which each regional district and its member municipalities
            participated in the issue;

the amount that each regional district and its member municipalities paid into
            the sinking fund;
any reinvestment factor that may properly be applied.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a regional district receives payment or credit under subsection
            (11) or (13), it must distribute that payment or credit in
          accordance with any written directions as to proportions for distribution that the
          trustees may make.

If there is at any time at the credit of the sinking fund account of a debt of the
          authority an amount less than the amount required in the account in accordance with the
          provisions of the bylaw or resolution under which the debt is created, the trustees may,
          despite the terms of the agreements with the regional districts relating to the debt and
          despite any payment or credit made under subsection (13), require the
          regional districts to pay over to the authority the amount of the deficit in proportion to
          the amount that each regional district shared in the proceeds of the debt.

The inspector of municipalities may require the treasurer to submit a report
          showing the state of the sinking fund for any debt, which must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
include full particulars of financial transactions for each sinking fund account
            during a specified period, and

indicate the basis of valuation of securities held at the credit of each
            account.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority must establish a debt reserve fund in accordance with this section.

Each regional district sharing in the proceeds of a security issue of the
          authority must pay over to the authority to repay the obligations to the authority under
          that security issue an amount equal to

bcl:text.#text:
1/2 the average annual instalment of principal and interest in respect of its
            own borrowing under section 411  of the , and

1/2 the average annual instalment of principal and interest as set out in the
            agreements entered into with, or securities issued to, the regional district by member
            municipalities with respect to financing under section 410 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Despite this Act, the amount required to be paid by each regional district under
            subsection
            (2) may be paid to the authority on the following basis:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
each regional district must, on receiving the net proceeds of the borrowing, pay
            an amount equal to 1% of the total principal amount borrowed;

each regional district must, without further requirement of bylaw or resolution,
            secure the balance of its liability to the debt reserve fund under this section by
            issuing to the authority a non-interest bearing demand note for the balance, bearing the
            signature of the chair and countersigned by the regional district financial officer or
            another officer designated by the regional board;

a member municipality of the regional district must, without further requirement
            of bylaw or resolution, secure the balance of its liability to the regional district by
            issuing to the regional district a non-interest bearing demand note for the balance,
            bearing the signature of the mayor and countersigned by the municipal financial officer
            or another officer designated by the council.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If an amount required under subsection (2) has not been paid over to the authority
          at the dates of the settlement of the proceeds of a security issue, the authority must
          deduct the amounts required for the debt reserve fund from the proceeds.

The trustees must hold that money to the credit of the debt reserve fund, and
          money held to the credit of that fund may be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
invested or reinvested in securities of the government of Canada or a province
            of Canada,

invested or reinvested in securities, the principle and interest of which is
            guaranteed by the government of Canada or a province of Canada,

deposited in, or invested or reinvested in investments guaranteed by, a
            chartered bank, or

deposited in a savings institution or invested in non-equity or membership
            shares of a credit union.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of subsection (5) the securities, deposits, shares or other
          evidences of indebtedness must mature or be callable within 5 years, and at least 25% of
          the amount to the credit of the fund must be callable within 90 days.

Money paid to the authority, under subsection (2), and interest
          received on it by the authority, are obligations of the authority to the regional district
          paying the money, and must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
be repaid to the regional district when the regional district has repaid the
            final instalment, or
be applied to the final instalments.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Any funds in excess of the requirements under subsection (2) that are an
          obligation of the authority under subsection (7) may, during the term of the
          issue,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
be applied to the debt reserve fund requirements of the regional district for
            future issues,

be applied at the discretion of the trustees to reduce the current annual
            requirements of a regional district as designated in the agreements between the
            authority and the regional districts, or
be applied to reduce requirements under section 27 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Despite subsections (7) and (8), if a municipality has discharged its obligation to
          a regional district with respect to a security issue, the authority may, during the term
          of the issue, repay to the regional district for the credit of the municipality a portion
          of the money that is an obligation to the regional district under subsections
            (7) and (8), and the money paid must be applied to reduce that
          obligation.

If, at any time, the authority does not have sufficient funds to meet payments or
          sinking fund contributions due on its obligation, the payments or sinking fund
          contributions must be made from the debt reserve fund.
The trustees, in the name of the authority, by resolution,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may, if they are of opinion that the payments made from the fund under subsection (10) may not be recovered under the terms of the loan agreements within a
            reasonable period, levy or impose on all taxable land and improvements in British
            Columbia rates sufficient to restore the fund to a level not greater than the amount
            that would have been in the fund had no payments been made, and

must impose the rates if the balance in the fund is less than 50% of the amount
            that would have been in the fund had no payments been made.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
This section does not apply to issues of the authority having a term of 2 years or
          less, and, if at any time the authority does not have sufficient funds to meet payments or
          sinking fund contributions due on those short term obligations, the trustees, in the name
          of the authority, by resolution, must levy or impose on all taxable land and improvements
          in British Columbia rates sufficient to meet the payments or sinking fund
          contributions.

If, after a levy under this section, all or part of the deficiency is recovered
          from the delinquent regional district, any money not required to maintain the debt reserve
          fund must be transferred to the operating fund established under section 17.

The authority may enter into agreements with public institutions and institutions
          prescribed under subsection (7) under which, on the terms and conditions established in the
          agreements, the authority, in its own name or otherwise, holds and invests money received
          from the institution for the purpose of investment in pooled investment funds as permitted
          for the institution.

The authority has the power to provide for the creation and management of pooled
          investment funds for the purposes of subsection (1).

The trustees may invest money received for investment in a pooled investment fund
          in any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
securities that are obligations of or are guaranteed by Canada, a province, or
            the United States of America;

bcl:text.#text:
investments permitted under the provisions of the  respecting the investment of trust property by a
            trustee;

despite the provisions of the , pooled investment portfolios established
            under that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If money is to be invested in a pooled investment portfolio under subsection (3)
            (f), the Minister of Finance may enter into agreements with the authority to
          sell units of participation in a portfolio to the authority.

At the first meeting of the authority in each year, the trustees must present a
          report respecting the previous year to the authority, stating all of the
          following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the pooled investment funds established;
the public institutions investing in each fund;
the volume of investments made in respect of each fund.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The trustees may delegate to a committee of one or more of its trustees and
          officers its powers under this section, subject to the limitations the trustees may
          impose.

The Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by regulation, prescribe institutions as
          institutions for which investments services may be provided under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The authority must establish an operating fund to meet the annual operating budget
        of the authority, and for this purpose may, in any year, impose rates not higher than the
        prescribed rates of all taxable land and improvements in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text:
means a class of property prescribed by the
          Lieutenant Governor in Council under section 19 of the ;

means a system under which individual
          tax rates are determined and imposed for each property class.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the authority imposes rates under section 17, it must adopt a
          variable tax rate system.

The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations in respect of the variable
          tax rate system as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing limits on tax rates;
prescribing relationships between tax rates;

allowing the Inspector of Municipalities under prescribed circumstances to vary,
            by order, the limits, relationships or formulas established under paragraph
              (a), (b) or (c).

bcl:text.#text:
The rates authorized by sections 15 and 17 must be
          levied on the net taxable value of land and improvements on the basis provided by
          section 26 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The secretary must forward to the collector of every municipality in British
          Columbia and to the Surveyor of Taxes a certified copy of the resolution or bylaw imposing
          the rates.

On receiving a copy of the resolution or bylaw, the collector must cause the rates
          so levied to be placed on the collectors roll.

The proceeds of the rates must be paid over to the authority by the municipality
          or the Minister of Finance, as the case may be, by August 1 in the year the rates were
          levied.

Until the proceeds of the rates are received, the trustees may borrow an
          equivalent amount, which must be repaid from the proceeds of the rates.

The authority may provide for the payment of remuneration to the members and for
          the payment of additional remuneration to the chair and to the trustees.

Any member is entitled to be reimbursed for reasonable expenses incurred by the
          member in connection with attending meetings of the authority or of the trustees or
          engaging in the business of the authority specifically authorized by the
          trustees.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority is a municipality for certain purposes

bcl:text.#text:
For the purposes of the  and the
        objects of the Municipal Finance Authority of British Columbia, the authority is a
        municipality.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Restriction on security issuing bylaw by regional
        district

bcl:text.#text:
After April 3, 1970 and despite the , the regional board of a regional district must not
          adopt

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a loan authorization bylaw under that Act, or

a security issuing bylaw under that Act on behalf of a member
            municipality.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subsection (1) does not apply if the financing is to be undertaken by the
          authority under an agreement under section 26.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Any of the following may give written notice to the authority and to the inspector
        of municipalities that, on and after a date specified in the notice, it intends to finance
        its capital requirements through the authority:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: [Repealed 2004-25-9.]
the Greater Vancouver Water District;
the Greater Vancouver Sewerage and Drainage District;

bcl:text.#text:
a regional hospital district under the , other than the Greater Vancouver Regional Hospital
          District.

If the authority is to finance on behalf of a regional district and its member
          municipalities, the security issuing bylaw of the regional district under the  may provide that the chair and financial officer of
          the regional district, on behalf of the regional district, are to enter into an agreement
          with the authority providing for the payment by the regional district to the authority of
          the amounts required to meet the obligations of the authority with respect to its
          borrowing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An agreement under subsection (1) ranks as a debenture debt of the regional
          district and must set out

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the schedule of repayment of the principal amount provided for in the security
            issuing bylaw, and
the interest to be paid on unpaid amounts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An agreement under this section may provide that if the debt, and all securities
          issued for it, are called in, either at the option of the trustees or the holders, in
          accordance with the terms of the security and paid at any time before maturity on the
          terms and on the notice or otherwise as may be specified in the agreement, the trustees
          must issue securities for terms not longer than the remainder of the terms of the
          securities so called in and paid, sufficient to realize the principal amount of the
          securities so called in and paid.

bcl:text:
If securities that are the subject of an agreement under subsection (3)
          are called in and paid in advance of maturity, the trustees must amend the agreements
          entered into in respect of those securities between

to provide for the repayment of the principal amount provided for in the
          agreements together with the interest to be paid on unpaid amounts.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the regional districts and its member municipalities, and
the authority and the regional districts

bcl:text.#text:
Amendments to the agreements made under subsection (4) must immediately be
          forwarded to the regional districts and municipalities involved, and despite the , the  or this Act, have the same effect as the amount originally
          set out in the agreements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a regional district enters into an agreement under subsection
          (3), the agreement must also include a provision that all costs of any
          redemptions of securities before maturity and reissuing are to be at the sole expense of
          each regional district involved.

The regional board must provide for and pay over to the authority the money
          required to discharge its obligations in accordance with the term of the agreement entered
          into under section 26.

If the money provided for under the agreement is not sufficient to meet the
          obligations of the board, the deficiency is a liability of the regional district to the
          authority.

The regional board must provide for and pay over to the authority the money
          required for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the payment of expenses in respect to annual bank charges for redemptions of
            securities, processing and paying of interest payments, and
the annual expenses for authenticating and paying agency agreements.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The following are jointly and severally liable for obligations arising under a
        security issued by a regional hospital district to the authority:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the regional hospital district;

the regional district that shares the same boundaries as the regional hospital
          district;

the municipalities forming part of the regional district referred to in paragraph
          (b).
